document_name: PRODOC Poverty Reduction Support Programme 6th-CP PSD.pdf

outputs.output_descr: In 2008, following the substantive revision of the project document on the Niger-Delta Job Creation ad Conflict Prevention Initiative,  also referred to as Youth Empowerment Programme (YEP). The is jointly funded by the Delta State Government, the Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria (SPDC) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and implemented by United Nations Project Services (UNOPS). The main objective of the project is to promote human security and sustainable development using youth empowerment, job creation and conflict prevention initiatives in the Niger Delta states of Nigeria

6th Country programme support to the development of sound economic policies in Nigeria towards poverty reduction
The major outcomes include: 
1. Support to the development of the State Economic Empowerment Development Strategy documents including well targetted poverty reduction interventions produced in 6 states.
2. Pilot poverty reduction initiatives developed and implemented and lessons learnt translated into policy
3. Strategies for promotion of informal sector developed in 6 states produced and results fed into policy.

The programme was designed to support national efforts aimed at reducing poverty levels so as to improve the quality of life of Nigerians through strategic, well coordinated pro-poor policy initiatives.

 Major activities and results include: 

1. Training for improving service delivery for SME operators undertaken		

2. SME operators trained in management skills for enhanced standardization and productivity	

The project was in the sixth country programme cycle of UNDP Nigeria and has since been financially closed

project_descr: The programme is designed to support national efforts aimed at reducing poverty levels so as to improve the quality of life of Nigerians through strategic, well coordinated pro-poor policy initiatives.
